title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate in Thailand 2024
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2014.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2022 to 2019.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2024 to 2022.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2018.
gold: Thailand 's gross domestic product ( GDP ) grew at a rate of 4 percent in 2017 . It is expected to grow slightly faster in the coming year before converging to a long-run growth rate around 3.6 percent . This steady growth can be attributed to Thailand 's relatively developed economy .
